title: Cambodian helicopter spotted crashed on mountain 17 days after being lost. No survivors seen
description: Cambodia’s Defense Ministry and state media reports say that the wreckage of a Cambodian military helicopter that went missing more than two weeks ago with two pilots aboard has been spotted on a mountaintop

title: Pakistan arrests top leader of radical party on charge of ordering the killing of the chief justice
description: Officials say Pakistan’s police have arrested the deputy chief at a radical Islamist party on charges of ordering the killing of the chief justice over his alleged support to the minority Ahmadi community

title: Israeli military detains 9 soldiers over alleged abuse of a detainee at shadowy military facility
description: The Israeli military says it is holding nine soldiers for questioning following allegations of “substantial abuse” of a detainee at a shadowy facility where Israel has held Palestinian prisoners throughout the war in Gaza

title: A diplomatic spat erupts between Hungary and Poland over conflicting views on Russia
description: A diplomatic spat has erupted between Poland and Hungary that lays bare the deep tensions between two nations — both allies in NATO and the European Union — with dramatically different approaches to Russia at a time of war in Ukraine

title: Greece announces nationwide restrictions to combat 'goat plague' outbreak
description: Authorities in Greece have ordered nationwide restrictions on goat and sheep to combat a deadly viral outbreak

title: Former South Africa president Zuma is expelled by his former ANC party after forming a challenger
description: Former South African president Jacob Zuma has been expelled by his former African National Congress party after he formed a new political party that contested the country’s recent elections

title: Bloodied children flee a stabbing attack in England. 8 people are hurt and a man is arrested
description: Emergency services say at least eight people, some of them children, have been injured in stabbings in northwest England

title: China's Xi calls for cooperation with Italy, evoking ancient 'Silk Road'
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping called for further cooperation with Italy on Monday at a meeting with Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, saying the two countries were the ends of the historical Silk Road trade route

title: Turkish official accuses Israel of targeting Erdogan after he seemed to threaten to invade over Gaza
description: A senior Turkish official accuses the Israeli government of trying to hide war crimes by targeting President Recep Tayyip Erdogan after he seemingly threatened to invade Israel

title: High Court judge in the UK upholds the government ban on puberty blockers
description: A High Court judge has upheld the British government’s emergency ban on puberty blockers

title: Australian inquiry will hear evidence that Christian extremists killed 3 in an act of terrorism
description: An expert will tell an inquiry that three Christian extremists killed two police officers and a bystander and wounded a third police officer in an ambush on a rural Australian property in 2022 in an act of terrorism

title: North Korean officials seek medicines for Kim's obesity-related health problems, Seoul says
description: South Korea's spy agency says North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has regained weight and has obesity-related health problems including high blood pressure and diabetes

title: Skyrocketing power bills draw protests near Pakistan's capital
description: Protests over skyrocketing power bills have shut down a major road into Pakistan’s capital as some 3,000 supporters of a major Islamist party continue a sit-in despite pouring monsoon rains

title: 1 person dies as Latvia and Lithuania are hit by a powerful storm
description: One person has died and some 200,000 households have been left without electricity in Lithuania and neighboring Latvia as strong storm winds and heavy rain pounded the two Baltic nations overnight

title: Vandalism hits communication lines in France during Paris Olympics
description: The French government says multiple telecommunications lines have been hit by acts of vandalism, affecting fiber lines and fixed and mobile phone lines as cities around France are hosting events for the 2024 Paris Olympics

title: French authorities say vandalism has hit multiple telecommunications lines as France hosts 2024 Olympics
description: French authorities say vandalism has hit multiple telecommunications lines as France hosts 2024 Olympics

title: Ukrainian troops say Russia's front-line push has driven them out of two more eastern villages
description: Ukrainian soldiers say Russian forces have overrun two front-line villages, after relentless assaults that are part of a Kremlin summer push to overwhelm battlefield defenses in Ukraine’s eastern Donetsk region

title: Rights group says sexual violence is rampant in Sudan's conflict, calls for international protection
description: Human Rights Watch is accusing the paramilitary group fighting against the military in Sudan’s civil war of rampant sexual violence against women, including gang rape and forced marriages of girls

title: Israel-Hamas war latest: US cautions Israel over escalation with Hezbollah after weekend attack
description: The United States is cautioning Israel about escalation with the Iranian-backed Hezbollah as Israel weighs its response to a rocket attack from Lebanon over the weekend that killed 12 youths in the Israel-controlled Golan Heights

title: 6 UK lawmakers are running to lead the Conservative Party after its crushing election defeat
description: Six British lawmakers have announced they are running to lead the defeated Conservative Party

title: Historic UNESCO world heritage park in Germany grapples with dying trees as climate change kicks in
description: The avenues, monuments and gardens in the park surrounding Sanssouci Palace, a sprawling green oasis in the heart of the German city of Potsdam and a UNESCO world heritage site, look as magnificent as ever

title: Indonesian leader starts working in new capital despite construction work and lack of facilities
description: Indonesian President Joko Widodo, who intends to spend his last few months of his presidency in the country’s ambitious new capital, has begun to work from the new presidential palace there, despite the continuing construction work and lack of first-cl...

title: Venezuela's capital is eerily calm after vote in which Maduro and opposition both claimed victory
description: An eerie calm has enveloped Venezuela’s capital, a day after the country’s opposition and entrenched incumbent Nicolás Maduro both claimed victory in the presidential election

title: The Galapagos Islands and their unique creatures are at risk from warming waters
description: The wondrous Galapagos Islands and its many creatures have always been sensitive to changes in ocean temperatures

title: Yazidis uprooted by Islamic State onslaught struggle to find stable homes a decade on
description: Ten years ago, Islamic State militants launched an onslaught on villages and towns of the Yazidi religious community in northern Iraq

title: North Korean officials looking for medicines for Kim's obesity-related health problems, Seoul says
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has regained weight and is suffering from obesity-related health problems including high blood pressure and diabetes, and his officials are looking for new medicines abroad to treat them, South Korea's spy agency told lawmakers on Monday.

title: Rights group says sexual violence is rampant in Sudan's civil war
description: An international rights group on Monday accused a paramilitary group in war-torn Sudan of sexual violence against women, including rape, gang rape, and forced and child marriage. A smaller number of incidents were also attributed to the military, it said.

title: Israeli strike killed 2 people in southern Lebanon, Lebanese media say
description: Israeli strikes killed two people and injured three others in southern Lebanon early Monday, Lebanon's state-run news agency said.

title: 6 U.K. lawmakers are running to lead the Conservative Party after its crushing election defeat
description: Six British lawmakers have announced they are running to lead the defeated Conservative Party, ahead of a Monday deadline, in a contest that will decide whether the opposition party tacks to the right or steers toward the political center ground.

title: Blinken and envoys from Japan, Australia and India work to improve maritime safety in Asia-Pacific
description: Top diplomats from Japan, the U.S., Australia and India meeting Monday in Tokyo compiled a set of measures to reinforce maritime safety and cybersecurity and to support other Asia-Pacific countries in improving their defenses during growing tensions in the regional seas.

title: Maduro locked in standoff with opponents as each side claims victory in presidential elections
description: Venezuela's opposition and President Nicolas Maduro's government were locked in a high-stakes standoff after each side claimed victory in Sunday's presidential vote, which millions in the long-suffering nation saw as their best shot to end 25 years of single-party rule.

title: Thousands in Ukraine honor soldiers killed in blast and urge government to get prisoners freed
description: Ukrainians urged their government to do more to get Russia to release prisoners of war, voicing their anger on Sunday at a ceremony commemorating the second anniversary of an explosion that killed more than 50.

title: U.S. intelligence community discovered TikTok censored for China, says Justice Department filing
description: The U.S. intelligence community determined that TikTok censored speech on behalf of the Chinese government, according to a Justice Department court filing.

title: Venezuelan election could lead to a seismic shift in politics or give President Maduro 6 more years
description: Venezuelans are voting Sunday in a presidential election whose outcome will either lead to a seismic shift in politics or extend by six more years the policies that caused the world's worst peacetime economic collapse.

title: France renews vow to defend freedom of navigation as it showcases fighter jets in the Philippines
description: France renewed a commitment to help defend freedom of navigation and overflight in the Asia-Pacific Sunday and said that its supersonic fighter jets - a pair of which landed for the first time in the Philippines - and advance military power would enable it to respond rapidly to any humanitarian or security crisis in the region.

title: Italy and China sign a 3-year action plan as Italian leader Meloni tries to reset relations
description: Italy and China signed a three-year action plan on Sunday to implement past agreements and experiment with new forms of cooperation, Italy's Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said on an official visit to the Chinese capital.

title: A strike from Lebanon killed 12 youths. Could that spark war between Israel and Hezbollah?
description: The Middle East was bracing for a potential flare-up in violence on Sunday after Israeli authorities said a rocket from Lebanon struck a soccer field in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights, killing 12 children and teens in what the military said was the deadliest attack on civilians since Oct. 7. The strike raised fears of a broader regional war between Israel and Hezbollah, which denied a role in the attack.

title: Russia's Putin vows 'mirror measures' in response to U.S. missiles in Germany
description: Russia may deploy new strike weapons in response to the planned U.S. stationing of longer-range and hypersonic missiles in Germany, Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Sunday.

title: Mudslide kills 15 people near tourist site in China as rains from tropical storm Gaemi drench region
description: Fifteen people were killed after a mudslide hit a homestay house in a tourist area in southeastern China on Sunday as heavy rains from what remained of a tropical storm drenched the region, state media said.

title: U.S.-Japan security talks focus on bolstering military cooperation, underscores threat from China
description: Japanese and U.S. defense chiefs and top diplomats agreed to further bolster their military cooperation by upgrading the command and control of U.S. forces in the East Asian country and strengthening American-licensed missile production there, describing the rising threat from China as "the greatest strategic challenge."

title: Lawmakers from 6 countries say Beijing is pressuring them not to attend summit in Taiwan
description: Lawmakers from at least six countries say Chinese diplomats are pressuring them not to attend a China-focused summit in Taiwan, in what they describe as efforts to isolate the self-governed island.

title: Russia-U.S. divide was on display during Moscow's monthlong presidency of the U.N. Security Council
description: Whether it's Gaza, Ukraine, Syria or a new world order, it's been Russia versus the United States and the West during Moscow's presidency of the Security Council this month, with the growing divide on vivid display.

title: Two meteor showers will flash across the sky around the same time in late July
description: Get ready for a meteor shower doubleheader.

title: U.K. 'broke and broken,' new government says as it prepares to tackle shortfall in public finances
description: Britain's new left-leaning government said Sunday that the nation is "broke and broken," blaming the situation on its predecessors ahead of a major speech on the state of the public finances that is widely expected to lay the groundwork for higher taxes.

title: Ex-diplomat, political newcomer, grandpa. That's Edmundo Gonzalez, Venezuela's Maduro rival
description: The past two months were unlike anything Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia had ever experienced: He gave political speeches, shook people's hands and waved from the top of a truck moving through cheering crowds gathered across Venezuela. He also shed the title of ambassador for that of presidential candidate.

title: Junior doctors offered 22% pay rise in deal to end strike action
description: If accepted, it would spell an end to a long-running dispute which has seen the cancellation of hundreds of thousands of appointments.

title: Far-right campaigner Tommy Robinson leaves UK on eve of court case
description: A senior judge issues an arrest warrant for him after he boarded a Eurotunnel train on Sunday night.

title: Jeremy Bowen: Golan attack leaves border war's unspoken rules in tatters
description: How Israel retaliates could determine whether the conflict stays limited or explodes into something much worse.

description: More than one in three US women now live in a state that has restricted abortion access since 2022.

description: Ban on puberty blockers introduced by last government using emergency legislation was lawful, High Court rules.
